metadata.title: CVE-2016-1237 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
nfsd in the Linux kernel through 4.6.3 allows local users to bypassintended file-permission restrictions by setting a POSIX ACL, related tonfs2acl.c, nfs3acl.c, and nfs4acl.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1237` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.19.0-66-generic - 3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-66-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-66-lowlatency - 3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-66-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-66-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-66-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-66-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-66-generic - 3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-66.74~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
